article.one.title: Internationalization (i18n) on Web Pages
article.one.content: Internationalization, abbreviated as i18n (where 'i' represents the first letter, '18' represents the number of letters between 'i' and 'n,' and 'n' is the last letter), is a process that allows adapting an application or web content to be accessible and usable by users from different regions and cultures. The main goal is to make the content understandable and relevant to audiences worldwide.

article.two.title: Why is i18n important in web pages?

content.details: The web is used by people from different parts of the world, speaking different languages and having diverse cultures.
By internationalizing a web page, the potential reach of the target audience expands.
Some countries have specific regulations regarding the presentation of content in their official languages.

details: All visible text strings for the user must be identified as localizable.
This includes titles, messages, button labels, etc.
Number, date, and time formats may vary by region. i18n should handle these differences.
Cultural differences should be considered when selecting images and multimedia content.
Automatic detection of the user's preferred language can be implemented to present the appropriate localized version.
Use libraries and frameworks specialized in i18n, such as gettext, React-Intl, or vue-i18n, which facilitate the management of translations.
Maintain translation files containing localized versions of text strings for each language.
Use HTML attributes like lang to specify the primary language of the page.
Allow users to choose their preferred language and dynamically adjust the content of the page.

article.five.title: Conclusions
article.five.content: Internationalization (i18n) is an essential practice for creating inclusive and globally accessible web pages. By effectively implementing i18n, companies and developers can provide a consistent and meaningful user experience, regardless of the user's region or language.
